Ben Yoo

Senior Product Manager with 15 years of experience leading both 0-1 and 1-N product development, digital modernization, and large-scale transformation.

Summary

Senior Product Manager with 15 years of experience leading both 0-1 and 1-N product development, digital modernization, and large-scale transformation for high-impact, highly regulated environments from government to entertainment. PMP and CISM certified professional skilled in architecting modernized solutions and aligning stakeholders to deliver secure, scalable, user-centered solutions. Led $130M+ programs, serving 24M+ customers, and recognized for cutting delivery cycles by 90%, boosting adoption by 50%.

Experience

Senior Product Manager

Mar 2020 - Sept 2025 | U.S. Department of State, Office of Consular Systems and Technology

  • Scaled the Online Passport Renewal service to 70,000 applications per week and cut fulfillment time by 20% by aligning stakeholders and cross functional teams to the established product roadmap, key performance indicators (KPI).
  • Achieved positive customer feedback rate of 95% by conducting deep-dive usability testing and translating complex customer pain points into crisp product requirements.
  • Achieved 70% user adoption of modernized communication system at the time of global rollout to over 200 missions and embassies by fostering a culture of collaboration across Training team, and Foreign Service Officers.
  • Cut deployment failures by 50% and release cycles from 6 months to 2 weeks on a shared Salesforce platform by optimizing internal workflows across 7+ teams.
  • Laid the foundation for future AI/ML development by collaborating with cloud infrastructure teams and assessing technical feasibility and trade-offs with engineering leads.

Branch Chief (Acting)

Dec 2023 - Apr 2024 | U.S. Department of State, Office of Consular Systems and Technology

  • Ensured 100% on-time delivery across 10 product lines with $130M budget and 265 personnel as both Contract Officer Representative (COR) and Government Technical Monitor (GTM).
  • Boosted overall team performance 20% by redesigning roles, aligning responsibilities to strengths, and instituting data-driven performance metrics.
  • Reduced decision-making bottlenecks by 40% by leading portfolio-wide initiatives that impact multiple product lines.

Consultant, Product Management

Aug 2017 - Feb 2020 | Accenture Federal Services

  • Reduced vulnerability mitigation time by 40% across all DOD solutions by managing the 0 to 1 rollout of the automated Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) Vulnerability Remediation Platform.
  • Accelerated delivery and velocity of automation features by 30% by rebuilding and prioritizing a 150+ item technical backlog.
  • Selected to lead AI/ML research across federal operations, identifying 10+ use cases and launching 3 pilot projects, including predictive analytics, AI vision, and workflow intelligence.

Consultant, Risk Management

Jun 2016 - Aug 2017 | Phase One Consulting Group

  • Delivered average of 6 months in schedule acceleration across 15 Veterans Health Administration Community Care Program Management Office (PMO) projects through early detection of risks/dependencies and structured mitigation planning.

Lead Product Manager

Jan 2016 - Apr 2016 | FundsFlo, Inc.

  • Decreased time-to-market to 4 months by streamlining the requirements gathering process and utilizing rapid prototyping to gain customer acceptance.
  • Reduced functional test durations by 50% by developing and implementing automated testing scripts using Python and Selenium.
